intro: Bidens patula, commonly known as the common beggar's ticks, is an annual flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, branching stems and small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Bidens patula is known for its ability to thrive in disturbed soils and is often found in fields and along roadsides.
